pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:0.4.eng: 4. The training rule on satisfying one’s own desires

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī sāvatthiyaṃ kulūpako hoti, bahukāni kulāni upasaṅkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī matapatikā abhirūpā hoti dassanīyā pāsādikā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena tassā itthiyā nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.4.eng: One morning Udāyī robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the house of a beautiful widow where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho sā itthī yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.5.eng: She then approached Udāyī, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho taṃ itthiṃ āyasmā udāyī dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.6.eng: And Udāyī instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho sā itthī āyasmatā udāyinā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.8.eng: “Venerable, please tell me what you need.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.9.eng: I can give robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.9.comm: “Robe-cloth” renders cīvara. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.10.pli: “Na kho te, bhagini, amhākaṃ dullabhā yadidaṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.10.eng: “It’s not hard for us to get those requisites.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.11.pli: Api ca yo amhākaṃ dullabho taṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.11.eng: Give instead what’s hard for us to get.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.17.pli: ovarakaṃ pavisitvā sāṭakaṃ nikkhipitvā mañcake uttānā nipajji.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.17.eng: she entered her bedroom, took off her wrap, and lay back on the bed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.18.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena sā itthī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.18.eng: Udāyī went up to her and spat out,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.21.pli: Atha kho sā itthī ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.21.eng: That woman then complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.22.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are shameless and immoral liars.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.23.pli: Ime hi nāma dhammacārino samacārino brahmacārino saccavādino sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā paṭijānissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.23.eng: They claim to have integrity, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and good.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.24.pli: Natthi imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ natthi imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ naṭṭhaṃ imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ, kuto imesaṃ sāmaññaṃ kuto imesaṃ brahmaññaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.24.eng: But they don’t have the good character of a monastic or  brahmin.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.25.pli: apagatā ime sāmaññā apagatā ime brahmaññā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.26.pli: Kathañhi nāma samaṇo udāyī maṃ sāmaṃ methunadhammaṃ yācitvā, ‘ko imaṃ vasalaṃ duggandhaṃ āmasissatī’ti niṭṭhubhitvā pakkamissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.26.eng: How could the ascetic Udāyī ask for sexual intercourse from me, but then spit out, ‘Who would touch this stinking wretch!’ and leave?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.27.pli: Kiṃ me pāpakaṃ kiṃ me duggandhaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.27.eng: What’s bad about me? How am I stinking?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.28.eng: How am I inferior to anyone?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.3.pli: kathañhi nāma samaṇo udāyī imissā sāmaṃ methunadhammaṃ yācitvā, ‘ko imaṃ vasalaṃ duggandhaṃ āmasissatī’ti niṭṭhubhitvā pakkamissati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.4.pli: Kiṃ imissā pāpakaṃ kiṃ imissā duggandhaṃ, kassāyaṃ kena hāyatī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tāsaṃ itthīnaṃ ujjhāyantīnaṃ khiyyantīnaṃ vipācentīnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.5.eng: The monks heard the criticism of those women,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.7.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī encourage a woman to satisfy his own desires?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.8.eng: Those monks rebuked Udāyī in many ways and then told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.9.eng: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.10.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.13.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.13.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.14.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.14.eng: How could you do such a thing?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.15.pli: Nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena virāgāya dhammo desito no sarāgāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.15.eng: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.16.eng: the stilling of the fevers of worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.19.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya— ‘etadaggaṃ, bhagini, pāricariyānaṃ yā mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ etena dhammena paricareyyāti methunupasaṃhitena’, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.19.1.eng: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, encourages a woman to satisfy his own desires, saying, “Sister, she provides the highest service who in this way satisfies one like me, who is virtuous, celibate, and of good character,” and if it is a reference to sexual intercourse, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.6.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.8.pli: rattampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ, duṭṭhampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ, mūḷhampi cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.8.eng: a lustful mind is distorted; an angry mind is distorted; a confused mind is distorted.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.9.pli: Api ca rattaṃ cittaṃ imasmiṃ atthe adhippetaṃ vipariṇatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.9.eng: But in this case “distorted” refers to the lustful mind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.11.pli: manussitthī, na yakkhī, na petī, na tiracchānagatā. Viññū paṭibalā subhāsitadubbhāsitaṃ duṭṭhullāduṭṭhullaṃ ājānituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.11.eng: a female human being, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.12.comm: Because I have rendered mātugāmassa santike (literally “in the presence of a woman”) simply as “woman”, the English rendering of the word to be defined is the same here as in the previous definition.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.13.eng: near a woman, close to a woman.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.15.pli: attano kāmaṃ attano hetuṃ attano adhippāyaṃ attano pāricariyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.15.eng: his own desires, for the sake of himself, aiming at himself, satisfying himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.17.pli: etaṃ aggaṃ etaṃ seṭṭhaṃ etaṃ mokkhaṃ etaṃ uttamaṃ etaṃ pavaraṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.17.eng: this is the highest, this is the best, this is the foremost, this is the utmost, this is the most excellent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.19.pli: khattiyī vā brāhmaṇī vā vessī vā suddī vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.19.eng: an aristocrat woman, a brahmin woman, a merchant woman, or a woman worker.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.21.pli: khattiyaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā vessaṃ vā suddaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.21.eng: a male aristocrat, a male brahmin, a male merchant, or a male worker.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.23.pli: pāṇātipātā paṭivirataṃ, adinnādānā paṭivirataṃ, musāvādā paṭivirataṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.23.eng: one who refrains from killing living beings, who refrains from stealing, who refrains from lying.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.25.eng: one who refrains from sexual intercourse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.27.pli: tena ca sīlena tena ca brahmacariyena kalyāṇadhammo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.27.eng: he is one of good character because of that virtue and because of being celibate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.32.eng: If it is a reference to sexual intercourse:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.33.eng: if it is connected with the sexual act.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.34.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.35.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.0.2.eng: Encouraging sexual intercourse to a single person or animal

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.1.pli: Itthī ca hoti itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.1.eng: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.2.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.2.eng: If the monk encourages the woman to satisfy his own desires, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.3.eng: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.4.eng: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a paṇḍaka …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.5.eng: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a man …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.6.eng: It is a woman, but he perceives her as an animal, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.7.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ itthiyā santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.7.eng: If the monk encourages the woman to satisfy his own desires, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.8.pli: Paṇḍako ca hoti paṇḍakasaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.8.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, he perceives him as a paṇḍaka, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.9.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.9.eng: If the monk encourages the paṇḍaka to satisfy his own desires, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.10.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.11.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he perceives him as a man …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.12.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he perceives him as an animal …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.13.eng: It is a paṇḍaka, but he perceives him as a woman, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.14.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ paṇḍakassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.14.eng: If the monk encourages the paṇḍaka to satisfy his own desires, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.16.eng: … (To be expanded as above with appropriate adjustments.) …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.17.eng: It is an animal, he perceives it as an animal …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.18.eng: It is an animal, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.19.eng: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a woman …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.20.eng: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a paṇḍaka …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.21.eng: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a man, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.22.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ tiracchānagatassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.22.eng: If the monk encourages the animal to satisfy his own desires, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.23.0.eng: Encouraging sexual intercourse to two beings of the same kind

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.23.1.pli: Dve itthiyo dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.23.1.eng: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.24.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ dvinnaṃ itthīnaṃ santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti dvinnaṃ saṅghādisesānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.24.eng: If the monk encourages both women to satisfy his own desires, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.25.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu Ss 2:3.2.4–Bu Ss 2:3.2.26, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.26.0.eng: Encouraging sexual intercourse to two beings of different kinds

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.26.1.pli: Itthī ca paṇḍako ca ubhinnaṃ itthisaññī sāratto ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.26.1.eng: It is a woman and a paṇḍaka, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.27.pli: Bhikkhu ca naṃ ubhinnaṃ santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsati, āpatti saṅghādisesena dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.27.eng: If the monk encourages both of them to satisfy his own desires, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.28.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu Ss 2:3.3.4–Bu Ss 2:3.3.61, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.2.2.eng: if he says, “Support us with robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.2.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.2.6.eng: “How a barren woman, may she have a child,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.2.7.eng: And dear to, may I be fortunate;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.2.8.eng: What may I give, how may I support,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.2.9.eng: How may I get a good rebirth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā vañjhā itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.1.1.eng: On one occasion a barren woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā vijāyinī itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.2.1.eng: On one occasion a fertile woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.2.2.eng: “Sir, how can I get a child?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.3.1.eng: On one occasion a woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.3.2.eng: “Sir, how can I get my husband to love me?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.3.8.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.3.8.eng: On one occasion a woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.3.9.eng: “Sir, how can I become more fortunate?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.4.1.eng: On one occasion a woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.5.1.eng: On one occasion a woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī kulūpakaṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.6.1.eng: On one occasion a woman said to a monk who associated with her family,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.6.2.eng: “Sir, how can I get a good rebirth?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:4.6.8.eng: The training rule on satisfying one’s own desires, the fourth, is finished.
